channel.title: [562/Rs2Hd] Making it Cost to Spawn?
channel.description: Hiya, Does anyone know how to make ::item cost money for spawn? I tried a few commands of my own, and they didnt work lol. Any ideas?

item.title: [562/Rs2Hd] Making it Cost to Spawn?
item.dc:creator: @geel9 geel9
item.description:
@geel9 wrote:

[quote=“TimmahPwnz, post:12, topic:340326”]offTopic;

People would just spawn money using ::item.

It’d be quicker to just use else{ instead of else if(!entire if statement repeated). Just saying. Other than that, nice job.

I think your dumb, my source prevents spawning of many objects (including money)…don’t post if you don’t know how to code…

hmm k thanks

Your a fuckhead, it’s called “Server Help” for a reason.

onTopic;

I think it might go a little like this? Imma just taking a guess.

if (cmd[0].equalsIgnoreCase("::item")) {
if (cmd.length == 3) {
int x = Integer.valueOf(cmd[1]);
int y = Integer.valueOf(cmd[2]);

if (x = Item Spawning) {
if (player.getInventory().contains(995, amount)) {
player.getInventory().addItem(x, y);
player.getInventory().deleteItem(995, amount)
} else if (!player.getInventory().contains(995, amount)) {
player.getActionSender().sendMessage(“You Need amount Of Coins To Spawn This Item.”);
}
}

NOTE: I just wrote that up off the top of my head, it may be wrong but it should be along those lines.
Also, if you are going to do alot of these items, maybe try using the .xml with the item names and strength bonuses. I was looking in there one day and found prices for Minimum, Market, and Maximum? Look around, and maybe you could find how to make a connection between them, good luck. Hope i helped a little.

  • Tim[/quote]

Read full topic

item.title: [562/Rs2Hd] Making it Cost to Spawn?
item.dc:creator: @TimmahPwnz TimmahPwnz
item.description:
@TimmahPwnz wrote:

offTopic;

[quote=“Pure Slay, post:3, topic:340326”][quote author=geel9 link=topic=436694.msg3208891#msg3208891 date=1274045447]
People would just spawn money using ::item.
[/quote]

I think your dumb, my source prevents spawning of many objects (including money)…don’t post if you don’t know how to code…

hmm k thanks :)[/quote]
Your a fuckhead, it’s called “Server Help” for a reason.

onTopic;

I think it might go a little like this? Imma just taking a guess.

if (cmd[0].equalsIgnoreCase("::item")) {
if (cmd.length == 3) {
int x = Integer.valueOf(cmd[1]);
int y = Integer.valueOf(cmd[2]);

if (x = Item Spawning) {
if (player.getInventory().contains(995, amount)) {
player.getInventory().addItem(x, y);
player.getInventory().deleteItem(995, amount)
} else if (!player.getInventory().contains(995, amount)) {
player.getActionSender().sendMessage(“You Need amount Of Coins To Spawn This Item.”);
}
}

NOTE: I just wrote that up off the top of my head, it may be wrong but it should be along those lines.
Also, if you are going to do alot of these items, maybe try using the .xml with the item names and strength bonuses. I was looking in there one day and found prices for Minimum, Market, and Maximum? Look around, and maybe you could find how to make a connection between them, good luck. Hope i helped a little.

  • Tim

Read full topic

item.description:
@geel9 wrote:

[quote=“Pure Slay, post:10, topic:340326”]Ok…so your all wrong. Its a 562, if you dont code 562 then don’t comment on this. I code 317, 508, 525, and 562. so im pretty sure i would know how to do it for a 317… Death here is the code its really long lol

[code]}

return;

From what I see, it just stops the player from spawning stuff, not costing them money. Lrn2copypastetherightcodefromsomeone’stutorial

player.sm(“You can’t spawn this item. It’s a rare pvp drops.”);

item.title: [562/Rs2Hd] Making it Cost to Spawn?
item.dc:creator: @usman555 usman555
item.description:
@usman555 wrote:

FIXED

if(command.startsWith("([size=14pt]pickup[/size])([size=14pt]itemID[/size])(i[size=14pt]temAmount[/size]"))){
if([size=14pt]hasItem[/size]([size=14pt]0995, amount of cash[/size]){addItem("([size=14pt]itemID[/size])([size=14pt]itemAmount[/size]"));
deleteItem(“0995, [size=14pt]amount of cash you want to delete goes here[/size]”);
}
else{ ([size=14pt]this part is if they dont have enough money[/size])
sendMessage("[size=14pt]Message if they don’t have enough money to spawn item goes here[/size]");
}

Thanks geel9.

item.title: [562/Rs2Hd] Making it Cost to Spawn?
item.dc:creator: @geel9 geel9
item.description:
@geel9 wrote:

[quote=“Pure Slay, post:3, topic:340326”][quote author=geel9 link=topic=436694.msg3208891#msg3208891 date=1274045447]
People would just spawn money using ::item.
[/quote]

I think your dumb, my source prevents spawning of many objects (including money)…don’t post if you don’t know how to code…

hmm k thanks :)[/quote]

You never mentioned that it prevents it. I assumed that since you were too stupid to know how to code in this, you couldn’t code in limitations.

[quote=“usman555, post:5, topic:340326”]if(command.startsWith("(pickup)(itemID)(itemAmount"))){ addItem("(itemID)(itemAmount")); deleteItem("0995, amount of cash you want to delete goes here"); (OPTIONAL)sM("You have spawned (itemID they spawned) for (amount of cash they spent) coins }[/quote]

Change 0995 to 995…I assume it works the same in 562 as it does in 317. You should also check to see if they have enough money, like so.

if(command.startsWith("(pickup)(itemID)(itemAmount"))){
if(hasItem(995, amount){
addItem("(itemID)(itemAmount"));
deleteItem("0995, amount of cash you want to delete goes here");
}
else{
sendMessage("Can't spawn this! Not enough money...");
}}

That’s pseudocode; I don’t know what your actual additem and whatnot commands are.
